pros: The graduates are awesome, appreciative and talented. The staff is focused, kind and knowledgeable.
cons: 1 campus, low employee turn around, positions are locked in for many years, advancement is slower...but achievable.

pros: If you are looking for a company that encourages a healthy balance of work and life this company is perfect. Hours vary depending on position but it was common for most employees to be on from 10am-7pm (which is great if you don't like to sit in traffic), Everyone is very friendly and professional
cons: There is not a lot of room for growth as it is a small company. There may be a need for more employee recognition and employee comradery activities.

job_title: Adjunct English Professor in Lake Saint Louis, MO
pros: Good support staff, nice facility to work in, dean of faculty is easy to work for and helpful in every way.
cons: NIght shifts:  5-10 M-F make it difficult for students to pay attention after a long day of work.  Also is impossible to assign homework as there is no time for them to do it.

pros: If you are teaching, then you will have few motivated students that would make it worth it.  Otherwise, not a place to build any sort of a career in.  Might be good for a part time teaching position, but that's about it.
cons:
Employees not allowed to talk to each other. If you go out for lunch, you get fired.
and Old school management with little to no room to grow

review_title:
Very unprofessional, no course outline or lesson plans, no even a textbook.
I've been teaching Electronics for over 30yr
pros:
Location is convenient
Easy parking
Good pay
cons: More than half of the class was ESL and I was not aware until I walked into the classroom
